Package org.neo4j.internal.batchimport.cache

Interface ByteArray

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, MemoryStatsVisitor.Visitable, NumberArray<ByteArray>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DynamicByteArray, HeapByteArray, OffHeapByteArray, PageCacheByteArray
    public interface ByteArray
extends NumberArray<ByteArray>
    Abstraction of a byte[] so that different implementations can be plugged in, for example off-heap, dynamically growing, or other implementations. This interface is slightly different than IntArray and LongArray in that one index in the array isn't necessarily just a byte, instead item size can be set to any number and the bytes in an index can be read and written as other number representations like int or long, even a special 6B long. More can easily be added on demand. Each index in the array can hold multiple values, each at its own offset (starting from 0 at each index), e.g. an array could have items holding values 
    byte, int, short, long
    , where: - the byte would be accessed using offset=0 - the int would be accessed using offset=1 - the short would be accessed using offset=5 - the long would be accessed using offset=7
    See Also:
    NumberArrayFactory

    • Method Detail

      • get

        void get​(long index,
         byte[] into)
        Gets the data at the given index. The data is read into the given byte array.
        Parameters:
        index - array index to get.
        into - byte[] to read into.

      • getByte

        byte getByte​(long index,
             int offset)
        Gets a part of an item, at the given index. An item in this array can consist of multiple values. This call will get a byte at the given offset.
        Parameters:
        index - array index to get.
        offset - offset into this index to get the value from.
        Returns:
        the byte at the given offset at the given array index.

        offset - offset into this index to get the value from.
        Returns:
        the short at the given offset at the given array index.

        void set​(long index,
         byte[] value)
        Sets the given data at the given index, overwriting all the values in it.
        Parameters:
        index - array index to get.
        value - the byte[] to copy into the given offset at the given array index.
